gw.plugin.logging

Interface TraceabilityIDPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface TraceabilityIDPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    This plugin is used to configure how traceability ids are propagated through certain inflection points of the system.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID)
      This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDCreationPoint enumeration.
      java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID, java.util.Optional<Message> message)
      This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDMessageCreationPoint enumeration.
      java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint, java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID, java.lang.String pluginName)
      This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDPluginCreationPoint enumeration.

    • Method Detail

      • withTraceabilityID

        java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint,
                                    java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID)
        This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDCreationPoint enumeration.
        Parameters:
        creationPoint - an enumeration indicating the current location from which this plugin is being called. This allows the user to configure a granular function that behaves differently in different contexts if different behavior is desired
        currentTID - a candidate traceability id that has propagated through the system up to this point. This would be some ID that arrived via HTTP/SOAP header or lies in the current MDC context
        Returns:
        the traceability to be utilized from this point onwards in the business process

      • withTraceabilityID

        java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint,
                                    java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID,
                                    java.util.Optional<Message> message)
        This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDMessageCreationPoint enumeration.
        Parameters:
        creationPoint - an enumeration indicating the current location from which this plugin is being called. This allows the user to configure a granular function that behaves differently in different contexts if different behavior is desired
        currentTID - a candidate traceability id that has propagated through the system up to this point. This would be some ID that is passed in the message
        message - the message that the creation point is dealing with. For more complex desired behavior, one may want to use contextual information on the message to generate an appropriate traceability id
        Returns:
        the traceability id to be utilized from this point onwards in the business process

      • withTraceabilityID

        java.lang.String withTraceabilityID(gw.logging.TraceabilityIDCreationPoint creationPoint,
                                    java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> currentTID,
                                    java.lang.String pluginName)
        This function allows one to configure how traceability ids are propagated at creation points indicated in the TraceabilityIDPluginCreationPoint enumeration.
        Parameters:
        creationPoint - an enumeration indicating the current location from which this plugin is being called. This allows the user to configure a granular function that behaves differently in different contexts if different behavior is desired
        currentTID - a candidate traceability id that has propagated through the system up to this point. This would be some ID that arrived via plugin or lies in the current MDC context
        pluginName - the plugin that the creation point is dealing with. For more complex desired behavior, one may want to use contextual information on the plugin to generate an appropriate traceability id
        Returns:
        the traceability id to be utilized from this point onwards in the business process
